name: ISSUE 182 / JANUARY 2014 - BLACK VEIL BRIDES / ASKING ALEXANDRIA AND MORE + HUGE POSTER SPECIAL
description: 2013 has been one hell of a breathtaking year for rock, and fortunately we're here to take you the biggest, the best, and some of the worst moments with the help of Asking Alexandria, Biffy Clyro, Fall Out Boy, Pierce The Veil, Bury Tomorrow, Sleeping With Sirens, Black Veil Brides, Avenged Sevenfold, A Day To Remember, Bring Me The Horizon, Don Broco and Falling In Reverse. Elsewhere in this issue: Hundreds of albums have been reviewed in Rock Sound this year, but which of those made our Top 50 Albums of 2013 list? We Came As Romans gear up to bring the mosh to the Rock Sound Impericon Exposure Tour 2014, Vic Fuentes answers your questions, Corey Taylor looks back to the past in this month's column, we bring you Access All Areas coverage of Vans Warped Tour UK, we rate Bring Me The Horizon, Thirty Seconds To Mars and You Me At Six live, new albums by Canterbury, Neck Deep and Billie Joe + Norah get reviewed, we team up with Santa to give you a special Smash & Grab prize package, plus there's a HUGE poster special featuring some amazing images from this year for you to whack onto your walls, and there's a FREE CD compiled by Pure Noise Records!

name: ISSUE 180 / BRING ME THE HORIZON + FREE POSTERS
description: For this issue's cover feature, we head inside the Bring Me The Horizon camp to give you the most intimate, no-holds-barred look into their lives as the biggest year for them draws to a close. Also in this issue we get the first interview with Of Mice & Men as they finally gear towards releasing album number three, The Amity Affliction discuss slapping each other with passports with a group of their fans in The Firing Line, Brendon Urie of Panic! At The Disco talks brewing beer, Trivium get ready to exorcise their demons with their new album, The Dillinger Escape Plan's 'Miss Machine' gets inducted into our Hall Of Fame, Deaf Havana prepare to rock like never before, we interview the likes of Alter Bridge, Mayday Parada, AFI and Dead Letter Circus, plus we introduce 19 of the best new bands in Exposure! We review the latest albums by Metallica, AFI, Protest The Hero and more, plus we rate Paramore, Crown The Empire, Issues, Motionless In White, Being As An Ocean and Chunk! No, Captain Chunk! live. And of course, let's not forget your FREE CD and size awesome posters including The Devil Wears Prada, Avenged Sevenfold, Tonight Alive and more!

name: ISSUE 179 / PARAMORE + FREE POSTERS
description: Having spent the last six months riding a rollercoaster, Paramore are preparing for their first full UK tour in nearly three years. We catch up with Hayley to see just how life has changed for the band off the back of their fourth - and most successful - album ever. Elsewhere in this issue we have new interviews with the likes of Crown The Empire, Tonight Alive, The Devil Wears Prada, Kids In Glass Houses and Touché Amoré. Funeral For A Friend get a hounding from five of their biggest fans in The Firing Line, You Me At Six gear up for a return to the spotlight, Jonathan Davis of Korn gives us an insight into his Life Lessons, Chris Motionless of Motionless In White quite literally gets suited and booted in My Obsession, Enter Shikari's 'Take To The Skies' gets inducted into our Hall of Fame, plus we bring you this year's rendition of the Reading And Leeds Awards. We give you our verdict on the newest albums by Panic! At The Disco, Rise Against, Deaf Havana and more, we rate the likes of Lamb Of God, Slayer and Gojira at Bloodstock Open Air, plus A Day To Remember, Pierce The Veil and The Ghost Inside give us the highlights of the Right Back At It Again Tour in their own words! To top it off you can enjoy the FREE CD filled with 15 killer tracks, plus six awesome posters of Letlive., Blessthefall, Crossfaith, Attila, We Came As Romans and Green Day!

name: ISSUE 178 / AVENGED SEVENFOLD + FREE POSTERS
description: It's been more than three years after the release of the emotional 'Nightmare', but after travelling down a long, hard road Avenged Sevenfold are back in action. In this month's cover feature, we get intimate with the band to get the inside story of their new album 'Hail To The King'. Also in this issue, we have interviews with the likes of Crossfaith, Blessthefall, Fall Out Boy, Panic! At The Disco, Rise Against, Bury Tomorrow and While She Sleeps. Sleeping With Sirens answer fan questions in The Firing Line, we take a look at the hottest threads in Merch And Destroy, Jimmy Eat World get inducted into our Hall Of Fame, Pierce The Veil's Vic Fuentes begins his venture as Rock Sound's new advice columnist, we bring you your guide to the perfect summer courtesy of Of Mice & Men, We Are The In Crowd, Don Broco and more, plus Asking Alexandria frontman Danny Worsnop gives us a crash course in the do's and don't's of life in our new Life Lessons feature. We also give you our verdict on the newest albums by Asking Alexandria, Stray From The Path, Avenged Sevenfold and more, plus we rate 2000 Trees, Alice In Chains, Biffy Clyro and Billy Talent live. Oh, and don't forget the usual FREE CD and 6 awesome posters!

name: ISSUE 176 / LETLIVE + FREE POSTERS
description: Prepare to have your life changed forever as letlive. finally return with their new album 'The Blackest Beautiful'. Born from love, loss and hope, we find out the incredible story behind one of the most brilliant striking albums of the year. Also in this issue we feature the likes of The Devil Wears Prada, August Burns Red, Mindless Self Indulgence, The JCQ, Killswitch Engage, and Heaven's Basement, a group of fans quiz We Are The Crowd in The Firing Line, we take a look back over Falling In Reverse's eventful year following recent turbulent events, plus we induct Boysetsfire's 'Tomorrow Come Today' into our Hall Of Fame. We review the newest albums by Sleeping With Sirens, Falling In Reverse, letlive. and more, plus Green Day, Paramore, Takedown Festival and The Great Escape get rated live. There's also a Download Festival poster special with Rammstein, Slipknot, Asking Alexandria, Mastodon and Coal Chamber, and don't forget the FREE CD featuring 14 awesome new tracks!

name: ISSUE 172 / PARAMORE + FREE POSTERS
description: After a lengthy time away from the spotlight, Paramore are finally back and on the brink of releasing their most important album to date. In this UK magazine exclusive, we bring you the full story of three people determined to make the most of a second chance. We've also got interviews with Cancer Bats, Buckcherry, Bullet For My Valentine, You Me At Six, Set It Off, Mallory Knox and I See Stars, Papa Roach take on their fans, we head to the studio with Sleeping With Sirens as they continue to work on album number three, we track down the hottest bands in our Exposure section, plus we induct Finch's 'What It Is To Burn' into our Hall Of Fame as they prepare to celebrate its 10-year anniversary. We give you our verdict on new albums by Killswitch Engage, And So I Watch You From Afar, Kvelertak and The Story So Far, we hit the road and go Access All Areas with All Time Low and Funeral For A Friend, plus we rate We Are The Ocean, Enter Shikari, Your Demise, Feed The Rhino and Black Light Burns live. Want a bit more for your buck? How about a FREE CD with 13 awesome tracks, plus six posters including Bring Me The Horizon, I Killed The Prom Queen, Breathe Carolina, HIM, Black Veil Brides an Sum 41? Sorted!

name: ISSUE 171 / LOWER THAN ATLANTIS + FREE POSTERS
description: After spending years on the toilet circuit and being underestimated since day one, Lower Than Atlantis have spent the last 12 months transforming themselves into the UK's most promising rock bands around. As they get ready to play some of the biggest shows of their career, we travel to Germany and back to get an intimate look into a band on the verge of something special. Elsewhere in this issue we've got interviews with The Ghost Inside, Biffy Clyro, Black Veil Brides, Funeral For A Friend, Pure Love, All Time Low, Of Mice & Men get a grilling from their fans, Avenged Sevenfold give us a quick lowdown on their new album and Trivium get inducted into our Hall Of Fame. The latest albums by Bullet For My Valentine, Foals and Heaven's Basement get reviewed, we go Access All Areas with While She Sleeps during their mammoth tour with Asking Alexandria and Motionless In White, plus we rate Mallory Knox, The Sword and Raein live. There's also six free posters including Sleeping With Sirens, Set It Off, Don Broco, Tonight Alive, Twin Atlantic and Converge plus an awesome free CD with 14 killer tracks on it! Nice!

name: ISSUE 169 / THE BLACKOUT + FREE POSTERS
description: As The Blackout get ready to unleash their new album 'Start The Party', we joined them at home in Wales to get the inside scoop on one of British rock's most loveable lots as they prepare to take the nation by storm all over again. Elsewhere in this issue we reveal who made the biggest and best 50 albums of 2012, we take you on an Access All Areas journey through the Rock Sound Riot! Tour, plus we get up close and personal with the likes of Young Guns, Asking Alexandria, Jonny Craig, Falling In Reverse, Lostprophets, Deaf Havana, Of Mice & Men, Twin Atlantic, We Are The In Crowd, Against Me!, You Me At Six, Frank Turner and more as they talk us through the last 12 months in their own words. New albums by Mallory Knox, Hacktivist, The Joy Formidable and Woe, Is Me get reviewed, we go Access All Areas at this year's Warped Tour UK, plus we rate Twin Atlantic, Deaf Havana, Parkway Drive and more live. Alongside all that we've got killer posters, the chance to win £3000 of band gear, and a free EP from Red Bull Bedroom Jam winners IDivide!

name: ISSUE 168 / BILLY TALENT + FREE POSTERS
description: As Billy Talent get ready to culminate two decades of hard work and heartache by headlining this year's Rock Sound Riot Tour, we follow them from Germany to London and get under their skin to bring you the ultimate and comprehensive story behind the band's most unlikely cult phenomenon. Also in this issue we have interviews with the likes of Yashin, Parkway Drive, Converge, Motionless In White, Brutality Will Prevail, Deftones, Stone Sour, Rolo Tomassi and Miss May I. Pierce The Veil get quizzed by a bunch of their fans, we bring you the hottest bands to check out this month in Exposure and we induct Killswitch Engage's 'Alive Or Just Breathing' into the Hall of Fame. The newest albums by Deftones, Green Day, Hildamay and Motionless In White, get reviewed, we go Access All Areas with Young Guns on the Vans Off The Wall Tour, plus we rate Trivium, Of Mice & Men, The Gaslight Anthem, The Skints, Straight Lines and Tonight Alive live. There's also a free EP by The Call Back Academy, six free posters and a CD with 14 awesome tracks! Get in!

name: ISSUE 167 / ALL TIME LOW + FREE POSTERS
description: After trading in life on a major label for a reunion with their old independent roots, things are certainly looking different for All Time Low. But in our exclusive UK cover story, the Baltimore boys explain how their return to familiar ground is anything but a backwards step. Also in this issue we feature the likes of August Burns Red, Twin Atlantic, Sonic Boom Six, We Came As Romans, Coheed & Cambria, Mindless Self Indulgence, Between The Buried And Me and Title Fight, Canadian punks Billy Talent get a grilling from their fans, Papa Roach dish the dirt on their latest album, our jam-packed Exposure section introduces all the hottest bands to check out this month, plus we induct Good Charlotte into our Hall of Fame. We give our verdict on the new Parkway Drive, Basement, Converge and Neurosis records, we go Access All Areas with Pierce The Veil, plus Freeze The Atlantic, La Dispute, Motionless In White, Devil Sold His Soul, Motion City Soundtrack and The Menzingers are rated live. There's also an exclusive Asking Alexandria poster special, a free Verses EP AND a free CD with 14 killer tracks!

name: ISSUE 166 / BRING ME THE HORIZON + FREE POSTERS
description: Bring Me The Horizon's journey from zeros to heroes of the UK metal scene is one of the most intriguing in recent memory. In this never-before-told story, the Sheffield mob take us on a trip down memory lane in this exclusive 8-page cover feature. We also have interviews with Lower Than Atlantis, Royal Republic, Vision of Disorder, At The Drive-In, Memphis May Fire, As I Lay Dying, Young Guns and Gallows, Your Demise get a little bit crazy with their fans, we present the Reading & Leeds Festival Awards, We Are The Ocean prepare to take a gamble, Motionless In White are feeling the pressure ahead of their new album release, and The Used are the newest inductees in our Hall of Fame. We bring you our verdict on new albums by Billy Talent, All Time Low, Green Day, Papa Roach and Sonic Boom Six, plus we rate Hevy Festival, Bloodstock, Minus The Bear, Fighting Fiction, Night Verses and Head Automatica live. To top it off, we've also got an epic Avenged Sevenfold poster special and a free CD containing 15 of this issue's best tracks!!

name: ISSUE 165 / GREEN DAY + FREE POSTERS
description: Over the past 25 years, Green Day have been called a lot of things like multi-million-selling rockstars, no-hopers, punk rock icons, political firebrands and even heroes. As they gear up to make musical history with the release of three separate albums, Rock Sound heads to California to find out just what they are playing at in our 8-page cover feature. Elsewhere in this issue we've got interviews with Deaf Havana, While She Sleeps, Turbonegro, Gallows, All Time Low, Circa Survive, Don Broco, Wes Borland and Yellowcard. Billy Talent talk to us about their new album, we go in the studio with Parkway Drive (spoilers: includes animals, surfing and Disneyland!) All-American Rejects get a grilling from their fans, our Exposure section brings you this month's hottest bands, and Panic! At The Disco's 'A Fever You Can't Sweat Out' gets inducted into our Hall of Fame. You can also find out our verdict on new albums by We Are the Ocean, Gallows, Lower Than Atlantis and Such Gold, plus we rate Incubus, Futures, Canterbury, I Killed The Prom Queen and more live. Want more? How about a 30 Seconds To Mars poster special, a Freeze The Atlantic album sampler, plus a FREE CD containing 15 of this issue's best tracks? You can thank us later!

name: ISSUE 163 / 101 MODERN CLASSICS + FREE POSTERS
description: 101 Modern Classics - After weeks of debating the list over and over, we can finally reveal the top 101 Modern Classic albums from the past 15 years that you must own! Find out our picks in the mammoth 12-page cover feature. We chat to The Ghost Inside, Gojira, Motion City Soundtrack, Miss May I, Make Do And Mend, We Are The Ocean, Yashin, and Mark Hoppus, Tay Jardine lends an ear, we hear both sides of the story behind The King Blues split, Simple Plan get a grilling from their fans, and Ginger Wildheart talks about being a record breaker. We also give you the verdict on new albums from The Gaslight Anthem, Bury Tomorrow, Linkin Park and Canterbury, give you the lowdown on Slam Dunk North and South and Banquet's Big Day Out, plus we rate Billy Talent, Limp Bizkit and Pure Love live. If that's not enough to keep you going, we've included a FREE CD containing 15 of the issue's best tracks, plus FREE posters of Parkway Drive, Emmure, Memphis May Fire, Falling In Reverse and The Word Alive.Your walls can thank us later!

name: ISSUE 162 / YOU ME AT SIX + FREE POSTERS
description: With the 2012 festival season hotting up, You Me At Six's adolescence is about to end as they prepare to embark on the biggest summer of their lives. Read all about it in our 8-page cover feature. We chat to Limp Bizkit, Lower Than Atlantis, Architects, Tenacious D, Futures, Funeral For A Friend, and The Prodigy, fans of Black Veil Brides ask them any question they want, plus we induct Hundred Reasons into our Hall of Fame. Elsewhere, we bring you the verdict on the new albums from Gojira, Miss May I, and Motion City Soundtrack, we check out Hit The Deck and Groezrock, and also rate Of Mice & Men, Lostprophets and Hot Water Music live. Not enough? How about a FREE CD packed with 15 killer tracks from the issue, and FREE live posters of Letlive., The Prodigy, Paramore, 30 Seconds to Mars, Fall Out Boy and Billy Talent? Yep, thought that'd do it...

name: ISSUE 159 - ENTER SHIKARI
description: Enter Shikari are one of the most exciting political rock bands around - and their new album is going to take over the world. Read all about it in our 8-page cover feature. We've also got interviews with Linkin Park, Pure Love, Black Veil Brides, Asking Alexandria, Say Anything, Every Time I Die, The Menzingers, Billy Talent, Sharks, Anti-Flag, Meshuggah and Lights - AND we induct Thrice's 'The Artist In The Ambulance' into our Hall Of Fame, and All Time Low get a grilling from their fans. We also bring you the verdict on the new albums from Your Demise, The Used and Soulfly - and then rate Brand New, Mastodon and The Devil Wears Prada live. Not enough? How about a FREE CD packed with our picks from the issue, and FREE POSTERS of You Me At Six, Of Mice & Men, Asking Alexandria and Corey Taylor? Yep, thought that'd do it...

name: ISSUE 156 / JANUARY 2012 - BLACK VEIL BRIDES
description: Black Veil Brides are crowned Band of the Year on the cover of Rock Sound this month as we head to LA to get the inside story on their incredible breakout year. Plus we've got the 50 best albums of the year, and features on Slipknot, Bring Me The Horizon, You Me At Six, We Are The Ocean, Alexisonfire, Avenged Sevenfold, Kids In Glass Houses, The Blackout, The King Blues, Defeater and more - plus all the news and reviews you need to know about. We've also got a free sticker sheet, a special pull-out of the most killer live shots of 2012, and a FREE Page 44 CD. Yeah, Merry Christmas to you too!

name: ISSUE 155 / DECEMBER 2011 - YOUNG GUNS
description:
We go to Australia with Young Guns to get the skinny on their new album, conquering new territories and how it feels to be on the verge of their biggest year ever! 

Elsewhere we've got Fall Out Boy, Evanescence, Lamb Of God, Enter Shikari, Deaf Havana, Five Finger Death Punch, A Day To Remember, You Me At Six, Korn, Rise Against, The King Blues, Sonic Boom Six and The Blackout in this packed issues.

Plus a FREE CD and Black Veil Brides bumper poster special!

name: ISSUE 154 / NOVEMBER 2011 - SKRILLEX
description: Yeah, you read that right - the future of music has arrived, and he plays dubstep. Find out why we think Skrillex is the shape of punk to come right here! Elsewhere, we've got stellar features on Black Veil Brides, Four Year Strong, Machine Head, Letlive, La Dispute, Young Guns, Breathe Carolina, Will Haven, Patrick Stump, Every Time I Die, Crazy Arm and Rise To Remain - plus a jam-packed Exposure section with all the hottest bands to check out this month, AND our verdict on the new Blink-182, Deaf Havana and Evanescence records. PLUS we've got posters from You Me At Six and New Found Glory, AND a free CD with 15 killer tracks!

name: ISSUE 153 / OCTOBER 2011 - YOU ME AT SIX
description: You Me At Six just made their best record yet - but before they released it, they had a lot to get off their chests. They head up this issue by confessing their sins to us. We've also got stellar features on Mastodon, Blink-182, Lower Than Atlantis, Saves The Day, The Devil Wears Prada, At The Drive-In, Tom Morello, Man Overboard, New Found Glory, The Horrible Crowes, Polar Bear Club, LaFaro, We Are The In Crowd, Transit, Jumping Ships, This Time Next Year, Dangerous! and Rise Against. Not enough? How about posters of 30 Seconds To Mars, Frank Turner, My Chemical Romance and Rise Against AND a free CD? Thought that'd do it...

name: ISSUE 152 / SEPTEMBER 2011 - 30 SECONDS TO MARS / DEFTONES
description: 30 Seconds To Mars and Deftones are both rock icons, but did you know that there's a history between them that goes years back? We got Jared Leto and Chino Moreno talking - and discovered the depth of their friendship in our exclusive feature. If you're a fan of either band, you HAVE to read this. PLUS we chatted to Trivium, New Found Glory, We Are The Ocean, Kids In Glass Houses, Charlie Simpson, The Bronx, Lostprophets, Taking Back Sunday, The Ghost Of A Thousand (RIP), Rise To Remain, Every Avenue, Into It. Over It and Enter Shikari and got killer features on the lot of 'em. All that, AND posters of The Blackout, The Devil Wears Prada and Architects along with another 14-track free CD? We're just spoiling you now.

name: ISSUE 147 / MAY 2011 - BRING ME THE HORIZON + MORE
description: Bring Me The Horizon, Architects and The Devil Wears Prada tore Europe’s face clean off before bring joined by Parkway Drive for what might've been the UK’s most intense tour ever. We were there every step of the way - and you'll find the full report here. Elsewhere, we've got killer features on Madina Lake, All Time Low, Asking Alexandria, Rise Against, Funeral For A Friend, City & Colour, Thursday, Yellowcard, Underoath, The Saddest Landscape, Hyro Da Hero, Max Raptor and MORE. That's right, more! Seriously, we're still trying to work out why you even bother buying other music magazines. PLUS! A free EP from the fantastic Make Do And Mend and 15 tracks on our usual free CD.
